docs.lead_paragraph: The state will offer tests to all pregnant women who have been to a country affected by the Zika epidemic, regardless of whether they show symptoms, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said.

headline.main: New York State to Offer Free Zika Testing to Pregnant Travelers
headline.print_headline: State to Offer Free Zika Testing to Pregnant Travelers Amid Outbreak

docs.abstract: Gov Andrew M Cuomo announces New York State will provide free testing to any pregnant women who have traveled to country affected by Zika virus outbreak, even if they do not have symptoms.
docs.snippet: The state will offer tests to all pregnant women who have been to a country affected by the Zika epidemic, regardless of whether they show symptoms, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said.

docs.lead_paragraph: Fear of the mosquito-borne Zika virus has Brazilians rushing to buy repellant, creating a shortage of some brands on pharmacy shelves and boosting sales for the industry - a trend some producers are preparing for elsewhere as the outbreak spreads.

headline.main: Mosquito Repellant Sales Boom in Brazil Amid Zika Scare
headline.print_headline: Mosquito Repellant Sales Boom in Brazil Amid Zika Scare

docs.snippet: Fear of the mosquito-borne Zika virus has Brazilians rushing to buy repellant, creating a shortage of some brands on pharmacy shelves and boosting sales for the industry - a trend some producers are preparing for elsewhere as the outbreak spreads.

docs.lead_paragraph: New Zealand's Olympic athletes and officials will be briefed on the risk of the Zika virus on Friday as part of their regular discussions ahead of this year's Rio Games, the New Zealand Olympic Committee (NZOC) said.

headline.main: New Zealand Athletes to Discuss Zika Risk
headline.print_headline: New Zealand Athletes to Discuss Zika Risk

docs.snippet: New Zealand's Olympic athletes and officials will be briefed on the risk of the Zika virus on Friday as part of their regular discussions ahead of this year's Rio Games, the New Zealand Olympic Committee (NZOC) said.

docs.lead_paragraph: Leading researchers in Brazil are borrowing techniques used to accelerate the fight against Ebola in the hope of developing a Zika virus treatment that could be tested in humans in a year.

headline.main: Brazil Researchers Hope to Test Zika Virus Treatment in a Year
headline.print_headline: Brazil Researchers Hope to Test Zika Virus Treatment in a Year

docs.snippet: Leading researchers in Brazil are borrowing techniques used to accelerate the fight against Ebola in the hope of developing a Zika virus treatment that could be tested in humans in a year.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nicaragua and Honduras have both detected their first cases of the Zika virus in pregnant women, the Central American countries' governments said on Thursday.

headline.main: Honduras, Nicaragua Report First Cases of Zika in Pregnant Women
headline.print_headline: Honduras, Nicaragua Report First Cases of Zika in Pregnant Women

docs.snippet: Nicaragua and Honduras have both detected their first cases of the Zika virus in pregnant women, the Central American countries' governments said on Thursday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Zika virus is putting a spotlight on a potentially devastating birth defect that until now has gotten little public attention.

headline.main: Zika Spotlights Rare Birth Defect With a Variety of Causes
headline.print_headline: Zika Spotlights Rare Birth Defect With a Variety of Causes

docs.snippet: The Zika virus is putting a spotlight on a potentially devastating birth defect that until now has gotten little public attention.

docs.lead_paragraph: The first time I met Solange Ferreira was in December. She was at a hospital, waiting to hear from a doctor whether her baby boy had what so many in her village were talking about — microcephaly, or an abnormally small head that is a sign of severe disabilities and a truncated life-expectancy.

headline.main: AP Photographer Reflects on 'Bucket Baby' in Brazil
headline.print_headline: AP Photographer Reflects on 'Bucket Baby' in Brazil

docs.lead_paragraph: With his wife about to give birth back home in Lake Placid, New York, American skier Andrew Weibrecht felt conflicted about traveling to Asia to test the downhill and super-G course that will be used for the 2018 Pyeongchang Olympics.

headline.main: Weibrecht Competes in Pyeongchang as Wife Goes Into Labor
headline.print_headline: Weibrecht Competes in Pyeongchang as Wife Goes Into Labor

docs.snippet: With his wife about to give birth back home in Lake Placid, New York, American skier Andrew Weibrecht felt conflicted about traveling to Asia to test the downhill and super-G course that will be used for the 2018 Pyeongchang Olympics.

docs.lead_paragraph: Thailand launched a campaign on Thursday urging citizens to get used to carrying condoms, as it battles a reluctance to use protection in the fight against HIV and teen pregnancies.

headline.main: Don't Shy Away From Condoms, Thailand Says Ahead of Valentine's Day
headline.print_headline: Don't Shy Away From Condoms, Thailand Says Ahead of Valentine's Day

docs.snippet: Thailand launched a campaign on Thursday urging citizens to get used to carrying condoms, as it battles a reluctance to use protection in the fight against HIV and teen pregnancies.
